devdoc.details: Step 2: Now Ownable - can be controlled by a multisig wallet  LEARNING POINT: This contract inherits from OpenZeppelin's Ownable. The owner (initially deployer, later multisig) can control certain functions. This allows the multisig to manage the registry settings.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

constructor.details: The deployer becomes the owner. Later, ownership can be transferred to a multisig.

params.initialOwner: The address that will be the initial owner  LEARNING POINT: Ownable requires an initial owner. We pass it to the Ownable constructor. This owner can later transfer ownership to a multisig wallet.

returns.hashes: Array of acknowledgment hashes  LEARNING POINT: This helps you see all acknowledgments someone has made.

Array of handshake hashes that this address is part of  LEARNING POINT: This function returns all handshake hashes where the address is either partyA or partyB. You can then use getMutualHandshake() to get the full handshake details for each hash.

returns.handshake: The handshake data  LEARNING POINT: This is a view function (doesn't cost gas to call). Anyone can check if two parties have mutually acknowledged.
returns.isActive: True if both parties have acknowledged each other

returns._0: The address of the current owner  LEARNING POINT: This function comes from Ownable. It's useful to check who controls the contract. After transferring to multisig, this will return the multisig address.  NOTE: transferOwnership() is already available from Ownable. The owner can call: transferOwnership(newOwner) to transfer ownership.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

submitAcknowledgment(address,string,byte.details: Party A or Party B calls this with their signature

params.message: The message they signed (must match what was signed off-chain)
params.signature: Their signature of the message  LEARNING POINT: This function stores the acknowledgment.
params.target: The address of the other party they're acknowledging

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: CollaborationRegistry

getAcknowledgment(bytes32).notice: Get a specific acknowledgment by its hash

getAcknowledgmentHashes(address).notice: Get all acknowledgments made by an address

getHandshakeHashes(address).notice: Get all handshake hashes for an address

getMutualHandshake(address,address).notice: Check if two parties have mutually acknowledged each other

getOwner().notice: Get the current owner of the contract

userdoc.notice: This contract stores mutual acknowledgments between two parties
